intro: Strobilanthes gardneriana, commonly known as the "Kangkeng" in Malaysia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer or early autumn. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
